items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Palestine applies for BRICS membership, says envoy; China ready to welcome more ‘like-minded partners’
items.summary: Palestinian Ambassador to Russia Abdel Hafiz Nofal told Russian media outlets that the country yet to receive a response.

items.title: Pakistani PM appeals for India talks in UNGA address, hails Trump role in mediation
items.summary: Had Mr. Trump not intervened in a timely way and “decisively, the consequences of a full-fledged war would have been catastrophic, Shehbaz Sharif said

items.title: Morning Digest: Ladakh administration says Sonam Wangchuk detained under NSA; UNSC rejects Russia and China’s effort to delay sanctions on Iran, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

items.title: Residents in Ambattur zone may get relief from sewage woes as Metrowater pipeline project nears completion
items.summary: The ₹106.42-crore project was launched to replace an 11.25-km sewer pipeline from Padi to the Kodungaiyur sewage treatment plant; it will be completed by mid-October, say Metrowater officials

items.title: New bridge across Cooum River to improve connectivity for western zones during monsoon
items.summary: Ward 143 councillor V. Rajan said the bridge replaced a low-level causeway that was always inundated during rain, disrupting traffic.

items.title: JJP criticises Haryana govt. for income limit in new scheme for women
items.summary: The BJP during the election had promised ₹2,100 monthly financial assistance under the scheme to all women, says party’s youth wing State president Digvijay Chautala

items.title: Trump says Gaza talks with Middle East countries are intense, will continue
items.summary: U.S. Special Envoy Steve Witkoff said U.S. Predsident Trump presented proposals to those leaders that included a 21-point Middle East peace plan

items.title: J&K L-G Manoj Sinha announces re-opening of 12 tourist spots closed after Pahalgam attack
items.summary: An official said out of 12 tourist spots thrown open, five are in the Jammu division and seven in the Kashmir division.

items.title: Every penny of Rangla Punjab to be used for flood-hit people: CM Mann
items.summary: CM Mann noted that contributions through Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) could not be made to the Chief Minister's Relief Fund, and even Members of Parliament can donate a maximum of 20 lakh to it.

items.title: Iran sanctions look set to return even as nuclear inspections resume
items.summary: I signed an agreement with the agency in Cairo, and the director general of the agency is quite satisfied and happy, says Foreign Minister Abbas Aragchi

items.title: In rare rebuke, federal officials discipline ICE officer for shoving woman in New York
items.summary: The altercation, which was captured on videos that spread quickly on social media, unfolded after the woman's husband was arrested at an immigration court in New York City

items.title: Giving warriors a fighting chance: Where personnel injured in line of duty are trained to become para-athletes and IT professionals
items.summary: In 2020, the National Centre for Divyang Empowerment was established as an exclusive facility for training CAPF personnel who suffer injuries and become physically challenged in the line of duty. In five years, the centre has trained 219 ‘Divyang warriors’, producing medal-winning para-athletes and

items.title: Ukraine says Russia drone incursion part of pressure plan against West
items.summary: Russia denies it planned to target anything in Poland with drones as it was attacking neighbouring Ukraine.

items.title: Two Kerala students allege assault by Delhi police personnel
items.summary: Denying allegations of theft, they say police officers brutally assaulted them, forced them to speak in Hindi and ridiculed them for wearing lungi; MP John Brittas seeks impartial probe into ‘custodial brutality’

items.title: Federal agents fire chemicals as protesters try to block car at immigration site outside Chicago
items.summary: Agents repeatedly fired chemical agents toward a crowd of over 100 protesters after some of the group attempted to block a car from driving down a street toward the ICE building on Friday

items.title: Tehran, Moscow sign $25 billion deal to build nuclear plants in Iran
items.summary: Iran has just one operational nuclear power plant in Bushehr in the south, with a capacity of 1,000 megawatts — just a fraction of the country's energy needs

items.title: DRDO wins businessline’s Changemaker of the Year Award for its strategic technology
items.summary: The Azim Premji Foundation won the Iconic Changemaker Award for its pioneering and extensive work in education and healthcare

items.title: UN Security Council rejects Russia and China's last-ditch effort to delay sanctions on Iran
items.summary: The resolution put forth by Russia and China — Iran's most powerful and closest allies on the 15-member council — failed to garner support on Friday

items.title: CBI coordinates return of UAPA accused from UAE
items.summary: Parminder Singh was wanted by the Punjab police in a case of alleged extortion, raising funds for terrorist acts, attempt to murder and criminal intimidation

items.title: PM assured help for Maharashtra’s rain-hit farmers: Fadnavis

items.title: Punjab Ministers blame Centre of ‘step-motherly’ attitude towards Punjab; Congress demands probe on floods
items.summary: What’s even more troubling is the Prime Minister’s announcement of a paltry ₹1600 crore relief package, of which not a single rupee has been disbursed to Punjab to date, says Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema

items.title: Govt. announces 100% waiver of late payment charges on water bills

items.title: U.S. rejects WHO non-communicable diseases declaration: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

items.title: R. Venkataramani re-appointed as Attorney General
items.summary: The President is pleased to re-appoint Shri R Venkataramani, Senior Advocate, as Attorney General for India for a further period of two years with effect from 01.10.2025, a notification read.

items.title: Depression likely to trigger heavy rainfall across Andhra Pradesh on September 27
items.summary: Well-marked low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal is likely to turn into a depression and cross South Odisha and North A.P. coasts on Satuday morning

items.title: APEPDCL mulling ‘Time of Day’ tariff to help domestic consumers save on power bills

items.title: Police said Sonam Wangchuk was being taken to Jodhpur, says wife

items.title: Bangladesh calls for urgent action to prevent ‘catastrophic’ Rohingya aid crisis
items.summary: I call upon existing donors to come forward with enhanced contribution and potential donors to make announcements of generous contribution to prevent this catastrophic situation, says Bangladesh’s interim leader Muhammad Yunus

items.summary: On September 20, three traffic police personnel were caught demanding and accepting bribes from motorists operating overloaded vehicles.

items.title: BPF leads in Assam’s Bodoland council polls
items.summary: The party was leading in 21 of the autonomous council’s 40 seats, more than 12 hours after the counting of votes began at 8 a.m. on Friday. The UPPL and ally-turned-rival BJP are set to win almost as many seats as in the 2020 polls.
